verses.roman:
gatvā te khāṇḍava-prasthaṁ
śaṅkhān dadhmur jitārayaḥ
harṣayantaḥ sva-suhṛdo
durhṛdāṁ cāsukhāvahāḥ

synonyms: gatvā—arriving; te—they; khāṇḍava-prastham—at Indraprastha; śaṅkhān—their conchshells; dadhmuḥ—blew; jita—having defeated; arayaḥ—their enemy; harṣayantaḥ—delighting; sva—their; suhṛdaḥ—well-wishers; durhṛdām—to their enemies; ca—and; asukha—displeasure; āvahāḥ—bringing.
translation: When they arrived at Indraprastha, the victorious heroes blew their conchshells, bringing joy to their well-wishing friends and sorrow to their enemies.
